alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Jackson; Putnam; Smith; White; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 07 at 6:52PM CDT until June 07 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHERN DE KALB, SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON, PUTNAM, SOUTHERN SMITH, NORTH CENTRAL WHITE AND SOUTHEASTERN WILSON COUNTIES... At 652 PM CDT, The public reported has already reported some flooding in the warned area. Widespread rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches have occurred just within the past couple of hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cookeville, Algood, Watertown, Baxter, Gordonsville, Hickman, Alexandria, Edgar Evans State Park, Center Hill Lake, Burgess Falls State Park, Cummins Falls State Park and Hamptons Crossroads. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: De Kalb; Jackson; Putnam; Smith; White; Wilson
